"Department of Prisons—Prisoners’ Welfare Fund  (Amendment) Act, No. 54 of 1979  [Certified on 30th August, 1979]  LD.—0. 19/75  AN Act 70 antenp THe Department oF PRisoNs—PRISONERS’  Wetranz Funp Law, No. 18 oF 1973.  BE it enacted by the Parliament of the Democratic Socialist  Republic of Sri Lanka as follows :—
1. This Act may be cited as the Department of Prisons— Short title,  Prisoners’ Welfare Fund (Amendment) Act, No. 54 of  1979,

2, Section 4 of the Department of Prisons—Prisoners’ Amendment  Welfare Fund Law, No. 18 of 1973 (hereinafter referred to {°,$°cho  as the “principal enactment”) is hereby amended by the No. 18 0f 1973,  insertion immediately after paragraph (a) of, that section,  of the following new paragraph :—
“ (aa) any such sum of moneys lying to the credit of any
prisoner in the General Deposit—Prisoners’  ‘Wages and Private Cash Account, as remains  unclaimed for a period of not less than one year  from the date of release of such prisoner ;”,
3. Section 5 of the principal enactment is hereby ‘Amendment  amended as follows :— to. section
(i) by the substitution, for the fullstop appearing at the  2uaciment
end of that section, of a semi-colon ; and
(ii) by the insertion at the end of that section of the
“(f) such after-care services as would help in the  rehabilitation of prisoners after their dis-  charge from prison.”,
